goal.title: End poverty in all its forms everywhere

indicators.title: Proportion of population with  purchasing-power parity income under USD 1,9; 3,2; 5,5 PPP per day
Proportion of population living below the minimum subsistence level
Proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions
Number of recipients of state pensions and benefits
Proportion of population living in households with access to basic services
The proportion of the adult population owning land (the number of owners and land users)
Number of victims and deaths resulted from natural disasters  and emergencies
Amount of damage from natural emergencies
Number of countries that adopt and implement national disaster risk reduction strategies in line with the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015–2030
Proportion of local governments that adopt and implement local disaster risk reduction strategies in line with national disaster risk reduction strategies
Proportion of domestically generated resources allocated by the government directly to poverty reduction programmes
Proportion of total government spending on essential services (education, health and social protection)
Sum of total grants and non-debt-creating inflows directly allocated to poverty reduction programmes as a proportion of GDP
Proportion of government recurrent and capital spending to sectors that disproportionately benefit women, the poor and vulnerable groups

goal.title: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture

indicators.title: Prevalence of undernourishment
Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the population, based on the Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES)
Prevalence of stunting (height for age <-2 standard deviation from the median of the World Health Organization (WHO) Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age
Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age, by type (wasting and overweight)
Productivity in the agricultural sector
Average income of small-scale food producers, by sex and indigenous status
Areas which introduced site-specific management technologies (as a percentage of the total sowing area)
Area of irrigated land on which water-saving technologies are used (drip irrigation,sprinkling)
Number of plant and animal genetic resources for food and agriculture secured in either medium- or long-term conservation facilities
Increase in the number of rare and endangered species
The agriculture orientation index for government expenditures
Total official flows (official development assistance plus other official flows) to the agriculture sector
Agricultural export subsidies
Indicator of food price anomalies

goal.title: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages

indicators.title: Maternal mortality ratio
Proportion of births attended by skilled health personnel
Under‐five mortality rate
Neonatal mortality rate
Coefficient of infant mortality
Number of new HIV infections per 1,000 uninfected population, by sex, age and key populations
Number of newly diagnosed HIV among injecting drug users
Tuberculosis incidence per 100,000 population
Malaria incidence per 1,000 population
Hepatitis B incidence per 100,000 population
Number of people requiring interventions against neglected tropical diseases
Mortality rate attributed to cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease
Suicide mortality rate
Incidence of mental and behavioral disorders, as a result of substance use
Harmful use of alcohol, defined according to the national context as alcohol per capita consumption (aged 15 years and older) within a calendar year in litres of pure alcohol
Death rate due to road traffic injuries
Percentage of women aged 15-49 years satisfied need for contraception
national_indicators.3-7-2-title

Coverage of essential health services (defined as the average coverage of essential services based on tracer interventions that include reproductive, maternal, newborn and child health, infectious diseases, non-communicable diseases and service capacity and access, among the general and the most disadvantaged population)
Proportion of population with large household expenditures on health as a share of total household expenditure or income
Mortality rate attributed to household and ambient air pollution
Mortality rate attributed to unsafe water, unsafe sanitation and lack of hygiene (exposure to unsafe Water, Sanitation and Hygiene for All (WASH) services)
Mortality rate attributed to unintentional poisoning
Age-standardized prevalence of current tobacco use among persons aged 15 years and older
Proportion of the target population covered by all vaccines included in their national programme
Total net official development assistance to medical research and basic health sectors
The proportion of health facilities which have a permanent stock of essential and affordable drugs and medicines
Health worker density and distribution
International Health Regulations (IHR) capacity and health emergency preparedness

goal.title: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all

indicators.title: Proportion of children and young people (a) in grades 2/3; (b) at the end of primary; and (c) at the end of lower secondary achieving at least a minimum proficiency level in (i) reading and (ii) mathematics, by sex
Proportion of children under 5 years of age who are developmentally on track in health, learning and psychosocial well-being, by sex
Participation rate in organized learning (one year before the official primary entry age), by sex
Readiness for school (percentage of children attending the first grade of primary school who attended a pre-school in the previous year)
Young people (age 14-24) who received technical and professional (vocational) training
Citizens (age 18-28) who received technical and professional (vocational) training as a proportion of total economically active population of the same age
Citizens (age 22-28) with higher education as a proportion of economically active population of the same age
Proportion of youth and adults with information and communications technology (ICT) skills, by type of skill
Digital literacy rate of the population aged 6-74 years by regions
Gender Equality Index by Level of Education
The proportion of pre-school organizations that created conditions for the education and training of children with special educational needs
The proportion of schools that created conditions for inclusive education
The proportion of Technical and Professional Education (TPE) organizations that created equal conditions and barrier-free access for students with special educational needs
The proportion of universities that created equal conditions and barrier-free access for students with special educational needs
Proportion of population in a given age group achieving at least a fixed level of proficiency in functional (a) literacy and (b) numeracy skills, by sex
The proportion of university students who participate in socially-beneficial activities
The proportion of college students (enrolled in technical and vocational training) which are involved in socially-beneficial activities
The proportion of children enrolled in schools which are offering renovated training curriculum
Proportion of schools provided with electricity
Volume of official development assistance flows for scholarships by sector and type of study
Proportion of teachers in pre-school institutions with pedagogical education

goal.title: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls

indicators.title: Whether or not legal frameworks are in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non‐discrimination on the basis of sex

The prevalence of physical and sexual violence by an intimate partner throughout life and currently among women aged 18-75 and women aged 18-49 who have ever had a partner, by type of violence and by the time period
Reductions in reported incidents of domestic violence against women
Reductions in reported incidents of domestic violence against children
Proportion of women aged 18–75 years (18–49 years) who have been sexually abused by anyone other than intimate partners in the last 12 months, by age
Proportion of women aged 20–24 years who were married or in a union before age 15 and before age 18
The proportion of women married when they were below 15 yrs old
Proportion of regulatory wastewater in the total volume of wastewater discharged through treatment plants in urban areas
Proportion of girls and women aged 15–49 years who have undergone female genital mutilation/cutting, by age
Proportion of time spent on unpaid home services for the household and its members
Proportion of seats held by women in (a) national parliaments and (b) local governments
Proportion of women in managerial positions
Proportion of women aged 15–49 years who make their own informed decisions regarding sexual relations, contraceptive use and reproductive health care
Number of countries with laws and regulations that guarantee full and equal access to women and men aged 15 years and older to sexual and reproductive health care, information and education
Proportion of women who have been granted agricultural land by ownership
Proportion of countries where the legal framework (including customary law) guarantees women’s equal rights to land ownership and/or control
The proportion of mobile phone users (age 6 and above)
Proportion of countries with systems to track and make public allocations for gender equality and women’s empowerment

indicators.title: Proportion of incomes  the bottom 40 per cent of the population

goal.title: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts

indicators.title: Number of affected and deaths attributed to natural emergencies
Number of countries that adopt and implement national disaster risk reduction strategies in line with the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015–2030

The proportion of local administrative units which adopted and implemented regional strategies designed to mitigate risks associated with disasters (these strategies were designed in accordance with national strategies)

Number of countries that have communicated the establishment or operationalization of an integrated policy/strategy/plan which increases their ability to adapt to the adverse impacts of climate change, and foster climate resilience and low greenhouse gas emissions development in a manner that does not threaten food production (including a national adaptation plan, nationally determined contribution, national communication, biennial update report or other)
Proportion of children covered by updated educational content

Number of countries that have communicated the strengthening of institutional, systemic and individual capacity-building to implement adaptation, mitigation and technology transfer, and development actions
Mobilized amount of United States dollars per year between 2020 and 2025 accountable towards the $100 billion commitment

Number of least developed countries and small island developing States that are receiving specialized support, and amount of support, including finance, technology and capacity-building, for mechanisms for raising capacities for effective climate change-related planning and management, including focusing on women, youth and local and marginalized communities
